textcomponents:
Topology: Troubleshoot Layer 3 Switching Issues

Use and refer back to this network topology diagram to correctly answer the three scenarios provided. VLAN 4 Layer 2 Switch (SW1) VLAN 3 Server VLAN 3 Layer 2 Switch (SW2) VLAN 2 Layer 3 Switch (SW3) L2 Trunk L2 Trunk
.
VLAN Subnet
2 10.2.0.0 /24
3 10.3.0.0 /24
4 10.4.0.0 /24
Scenario 1: Troubleshoot Layer 3 Switching Issues

PC2 is unable to communicate with PC3, but can communicate with all other devices. Click below to select the most likely causes for this issue. More than one answer choice may be selected. Use the Layer 3 switch command output and refer back to the network topology diagram to correctly answer this scenario. VLAN 3 and 4 are shutdown VLAN 3 IP address is not correct VLAN 4 has no IP address VLAN 2 is not configured VLAN 5 IP address is not correct Correct You have successfully identified the Layer 3 switching issues. Please click button 3 to continue. Incorrect You have not successfully identified the Layer 3 switching issues. Please click Reset to try again. Check Reset Scenario 2: Troubleshoot Layer 3 Switching Issues

PC2 is unable to communicate with any of the other devices, including itâ€™s own gateway. Click below to select the most likely causes for this issue. More than one answer choice may be selected. Use the Layer 3 switch command output and refer back to the network topology diagram to correctly answer this scenario. VLAN 2 subnet mask is not correct VLAN 3 IP address is not correct VLAN 4 subnet mask is not correct VLAN 2 is not configured VLAN 4 IP address is not correct Correct You have successfully identified the Layer 3 switching issues. Please click button 4 to continue. Incorrect You have not successfully identified the Layer 3 switching issues. Please click Reset to try again. Check Reset Scenario 3: Troubleshoot Layer 3 Switching Issues

PC1 is unable to communicate with PC2 or PC3, but can communicate with the server. Click below to select the most likely causes for this issue. More than one answer choice may be selected. Use the Layer 3 switch command output and refer back to the network topology diagram to correctly answer this scenario. The trunk encapsulation is not correct VLAN 2 and 3 are being pruned from the trunk links The gigabit 0/1 port is not configured as a trunk VLAN 2 is not configured The gigabit 0/2 port is not configured as a trunk SW2 is shutdown Correct You have successfully identified the Layer 3 switching issues. Incorrect You have not successfully identified the Layer 3 switching issues. Please click Reset to try again. Check Reset -->
